GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "Gamma_Sleep".

redcap:Surveys.title: Screening Survey
redcap:Surveys.instructions:
DEUTSCH / ENGLISH

Welcome!

Thank you for your interest in my study.

Before inviting you to our lab, I would like to check if you are eligible to participate: that is what this short survey is for. I will ask you a few questions about your health and sleep.

At the end of the survey, if you are eligible and willing to enrol, you will be asked for information that can identify you (name & email), so we can schedule your first study session. You only decide if you agree to take part in the study or not at that session; consent is not granted just by filling in this survey.

Survey data will be securely stored on the REDCap platform for the duration of the study (Feb - Dec 2023), but you may request the deletion of your data anytime.

Survey completion time: approx. 5 min

What is the study about?

Within my PhD project at TU Munich, I am looking into the effects of rapidly flickering light on brain activity during sleep. The goal is to enhance a certain form of brain activity which is impaired in conditions such as Alzheimer’s Disease: new research shows that rapidly flickering light can do that. I want to test if applying it during sleep is feasible and effective in young, healthy people. If so, then we can try it on older people at risk for dementia next.

My aim is to help prevent or delay dementia with an intervention that is not invasive, not expensive, and as convenient as possible for patients. That can only happen with the help of people like you!

The experiment involves the following sessions (all taking place on weekends):

  1. A 1,5-hour session in which you provide your informed consent and the stimulation is individually adapted to you, then it is applied to you while you are awake.
  2. One night at the sleep lab (on a Friday or Saturday), on which only your brain activity is measured, so we can see what your “usual” sleep is like.
  3. One more night at the sleep lab (on the following night), on which your brain activity is measured and the light stimulation is activated while you sleep.

On the first session, I am happy to provide more details and answer any questions. Participants are reimbursed for their time with a value up to 100 € and are also offered an individualized report of their sleep.
redcap:Surveys.acknowledgement:
Good job, you have successfully completed the survey!

You will receive an email from me very soon.

Have a great day :)

 

 

Laura Hainke
(PhD Candidate)

Technical University of Munich
Department for Sport and Health Sciences
Assistant Professorship of Chronobiology & Health
laura.hainke@tum.de
redcap:Surveys.stop_action_acknowledgement:
Thank you for filling in the questionnaire. Unfortunately, we cannot include you in this study at this point, since one or more exclusion criteria possibly apply to you. Please understand this is for your safety, we do not want to put anyone at risk with our experiment. Your interest is much appreciated nonetheless.

If you have any questions, please reach out.

Have a good day!

 

 

Laura Hainke
(PhD Candidate)

Technical University of Munich
Department for Sport and Health Sciences
Assistant Professorship of Chronobiology & Health
laura.hainke@tum.de
redcap:Surveys.response_limit_custom_text: Thank you for your interest; however, the survey is closed because the maximum number of responses has been reached.

ItemGroupDef.Name:
Exclusion Criteria

You will be asked about some symptoms or disorders you may have experienced. Please answer honestly, so that we can ensure your well-being and safety during the course of this study.

If you are not sure whether something you experienced counts as a symptom or disorder, please choose "maybe" and specify it.

Your Chronotype

Munich ChronoType Questionnaire (µMCTQ)

The following section will ask you questions in regards to your sleep and wake behaviour on work- and work-free days. Please estimate an average of your 'normal' sleep behaviour over the past 6 weeks.

Thank you for your answers.

Based on the information you provided, we will check if you are eligible to participate.

To be enrolled as a participant, please fill in:

Question.TranslatedText: Record ID
Preferred language
I have read the information above and consider volunteering for this study.

ItemDef.Name: cutoff_age
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
Exclusion Criteria

You will be asked about some symptoms or disorders you may have experienced. Please answer honestly, so that we can ensure your well-being and safety during the course of this study.

If you are not sure whether something you experienced counts as a symptom or disorder, please choose "maybe" and specify it.

Question.TranslatedText: Are you between 18 and 35 years old?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: Are you between 18 and 35 years old?

Question.TranslatedText: Do you have any difficulty distinguishing between red and green, or between yellow and blue (colour-blindness)?

At any point in your life, have you experienced any of the following: Uncontrolled shaking movements of your whole body or parts of it, with full or partial loss of consciousness (Epilepsy, Seizures) Pulsating headaches possibly accompanied by nausea, sensitivity to light / sound / smell, visual disturbances (Migraine) Surgery on your brain (e.g., to remove a brain tumor, to perform an implant…) Severe concussion Stroke Other neurological conditions
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
At any point in your life, have you experienced any of the following:

  • Uncontrolled shaking movements of your whole body or parts of it, with full or partial loss of consciousness (Epilepsy, Seizures)
  • Pulsating headaches possibly accompanied by nausea, sensitivity to light / sound / smell, visual disturbances (Migraine)
  • Surgery on your brain (e.g., to remove a brain tumor, to perform an implant…)
  • Severe concussion
  • Stroke
  • Other neurological conditions

Question.TranslatedText: Please specify:

In the past year, have you experienced any of these sleep disturbances? Or has anyone remarked that you do? Regular difficulty falling or staying asleep (Insomnia) Walking or carrying out complex activities during the night while not fully awake, without remembering them afterward (Sleepwalking) Involuntary habitual grinding of the teeth during sleep (Bruxism) Excessive daytime sleepiness with sudden muscle weakness (Narcolepsy) Unpleasant “creeping” sensation and pain in the lower legs that can be relieved by movement of the legs, such as walking or kicking (Restless Legs Syndrome) Periodically interrupted breathing during sleep that causes gasping or “snorting” noises, more than just snoring (Sleep Apnoea)
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
In the past year, have you experienced any of these sleep disturbances? Or has anyone remarked that you do?

  • Regular difficulty falling or staying asleep (Insomnia)
  • Walking or carrying out complex activities during the night while not fully awake, without remembering them afterward (Sleepwalking)
  • Involuntary habitual grinding of the teeth during sleep (Bruxism)
  • Excessive daytime sleepiness with sudden muscle weakness (Narcolepsy)
  • Unpleasant “creeping” sensation and pain in the lower legs that can be relieved by movement of the legs, such as walking or kicking (Restless Legs Syndrome)
  • Periodically interrupted breathing during sleep that causes gasping or “snorting” noises, more than just snoring (Sleep Apnoea)

Question.TranslatedText: Please specify:

In the past year, have you experienced any of these psychiatric symptoms? Depressed mood Extreme mood swings Excessive fears or worries Hallucinations or paranoia Suicidal thoughts Other mental issues
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
In the past year, have you experienced any of these psychiatric symptoms?

  • Depressed mood
  • Extreme mood swings
  • Excessive fears or worries
  • Hallucinations or paranoia
  • Suicidal thoughts
  • Other mental issues

Question.TranslatedText: Please specify:

In the past year, have you excessively used any of these substances? Alcohol (drinking more than 5 beers or 10 shots on most weeks) Nicotine (smoking more than 5 cigarettes on most days) Cannabis (consuming on most days / negative consequences in daily life / withdrawal symptoms) Prescription drugs (using in a higher quantity or for a longer time than prescribed by doctors / withdrawal symptoms) Other illicit drugs (consumption of any illicit drug on most months)
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
In the past year, have you excessively used any of these substances?

  • Alcohol (drinking more than 5 beers or 10 shots on most weeks)
  • Nicotine (smoking more than 5 cigarettes on most days)
  • Cannabis (consuming on most days / negative consequences in daily life / withdrawal symptoms)
  • Prescription drugs (using in a higher quantity or for a longer time than prescribed by doctors / withdrawal symptoms)
  • Other illicit drugs (consumption of any illicit drug on most months)

Question.TranslatedText: Please specify:
Please double-check: Have you correctly chosen the options that apply to you?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: Please double-check: Have you correctly chosen the options that apply to you?

ItemDef.Name: shift_work
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
Your Chronotype

Munich ChronoType Questionnaire (µMCTQ)

The following section will ask you questions in regards to your sleep and wake behaviour on work- and work-free days. Please estimate an average of your 'normal' sleep behaviour over the past 6 weeks.

Question.TranslatedText: I have been a shift- or night-worker in the past three months:
Normally, I work ___ days / week:
Please answer all the following questions even if you do not work, or work 7 days / week. Use the 24-hour format (e.g., 23:00 instead of 11 PM).

ItemDef.Name: fall_asleep_work
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: This is NOT when you get into bed, but rather when you fall asleep

Question.TranslatedText: On workdays, I normally fall asleep at:
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On workdays, I normally fall asleep at:

ItemDef.Name: wake_up_work
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: This is NOT when you get out of bed, but rather when you wake up

Question.TranslatedText: On workdays, I normally wake up at:
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On workdays, I normally wake up at:

ItemDef.Name: fall_asleep_free
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: This is NOT when you get into bed, but rather when you fall asleep

Question.TranslatedText: On work-free days, when I DON'T use an alarm clock, I normally fall asleep at:
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On work-free days, when I DON'T use an alarm clock, I normally fall asleep at:

ItemDef.Name: wake_up_free
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: This is NOT when you get out of bed, but rather when you wake up

Question.TranslatedText: On work-free days, when I DON'T use an alarm clock, I normally wake up at:
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On work-free days, when I DON'T use an alarm clock, I normally wake up at:

Question.TranslatedText: On MOST work-free days, do you use an alarm clock?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On MOST work-free days, do you use an alarm clock?

ItemDef.Name: name
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
Thank you for your answers.

Based on the information you provided, we will check if you are eligible to participate.

To be enrolled as a participant, please fill in:

Question.TranslatedText: Your full name
Your age (in years)

ErrorMessage.TranslatedText: The value you provided is outside the suggested range (18 - 35). This value is admissible, but you may wish to double check it.
The value you provided is outside the suggested range (18 - 35). This value is admissible, but you may wish to double check it.

Question.TranslatedText: Your gender identity
Your email
Complete?

Decode.TranslatedText: Yes, let's proceed with the questionnaire.
No, I prefer not to take part.
